newsitem.title: FRANCE: Suez announces return to profit, backs merger.
newsitem.headline: Suez announces return to profit, backs merger.

text.p: French holding company Cie de Suez announced on Tuesday it returned to profit in 1996 and said its board had unanimously approved in principle a merger with utilities group Lyonnaise des Eaux.
It said in a statement it made a net attributable profit -- after payment to minorities -- of 843 million francs ($149.8 million) in 1996 after a loss of 3.96 billion francs the year before.
Analysts had forecast a net profit -- before payment to minorities -- of about 1.15 billion francs.

Suez also said its board had agreed to make a special dividend payment in June, reflecting capital gains made last year on the sale of investment bank Banque Indosuez. A Suez spokeswoman declined comment on the amount of the dividend.

Suez shareholders are looking for a special dividend payout to win their backing for its planned merger with Lyonnaise des Eaux, due to be discussed at special board meetings of both companies on April 11.
"The board has unanimously favourably welcomed the principle of this merger," Suez said in its statement, without giving further details of its merger plans.
